definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against

sentences.english: Sergeant Howard was reduced to the ranks for disregard of orders.
sentences.chinese: 霍华德士官因为违抗命令而被降为小兵。

sentences.english: Answer or you may regret your disobedience.
sentences.chinese: 回答，否则你们会为自己违抗命令后悔的。

sentences.english: But they have been a defiance of the military orders.
sentences.chinese: 但他们已属于违抗军令了。

sentences.english: Eating me, you will violate the command of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 你要吃了我，就违抗了天帝的命令。

sentences.english: Whoever violingesteds the disciplines should be criticized.
sentences.chinese: 谁违抗了纪律，谁就该当遭到月旦。

sentences.english: By eating me, you will violate the command of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 你要吃了我，就违抗了天帝的命令。

sentences.english: Mindy, how dare you defy me.
Mu Zhixiao of one's proper business, not dare defy, be seized without fighting.
sentences.chinese: 正事母至孝，不敢违抗，束手就擒。

sentences.english: The sergeant was degraded to private for the reason of disobeying order.
sentences.chinese: 这个军官因为违抗命令被秘密降级了。

sentences.english: The general was relieved of his command .
sentences.chinese: 这位将军因为违抗命令被解除指挥权。

sentences.english: Oberon: Wait, foolish fairy, why do you oppose me so?
sentences.chinese: 等一等，傻精灵，你为什么要违抗我？

sentences.english: He was punished for disobeying orders.
sentences.chinese: 他因违抗命令而受到惩罚。

sentences.english: Police denied rumors that the captain was punished for defying orders.
sentences.chinese: 否认了那位长官因为违抗命令而被惩罚的谣言。

definition: to disobey/to defy an edict/to violate/to go against/to run counter to
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
disobedient/to violate the Mandate of Heaven (天命[Tian1 Ming4])
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
military orders are like mountains (idiom)/a military order must be obeyed
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
